''Google also announced that its board of directors had approved certain changes to Google's management team,'' the company said in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Larry Page, Google's co-founder and president of products, will become Google's chief executive officer, effective April 4, 2011. '' Eric Schmidt , Google's current chief executive officer, will continue as the chairman of the board of directors and will serve as Google's executive chairman. As executive chairman, Google said, Eric Schmidt will act as an advisor to Page and Sergey Brin , Google's other co-founder and president of technology. Eric Schmidt Steps Down; Co-founder Page is New Google CEO Mark Hefflinger on January 20, 2011- 10:35 am. Mountain View, Calif.- Citing a desire to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility at the top of the company, Google on Thursday announced that CEO Eric Schmidt will step down, becoming executive chairman, while co-founder Larry Page will take over as chief executive. ''Every president has a challenge when it goes from campaigning to governing, takes a while to figure out the difference between campaigning and governing,'' Colin Powell said on CNN's ''State of the Union.'' Now we see at the end of the second year, he is definitely focusing on governing... we'll see how 2011 goes. Colin Powell , who worked in four presidential administrations- most recently under former President Bush - said he expects a strong economic message at the State of the Union address Tuesday.
